"I know you disapprove of charity," he said, breathless. 

"But you slipped her a hundred roubles," I replied. 

He looked away. "I wanted to surprise her." 

"Or test her," I suggested. 

"Perhaps," he admitted, wiping his brow. 

"I thought she might lose it," I continued. 

He sighed, defeated. "I just wanted to help." 

"You could have said so," I said softly. 

He nodded, exhausted. "I thought it best this way." 

The room felt heavy with unspoken words.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** The speaker reflects on the complexities of charitable actions and the motivations behind them, questioning the sincerity of private benevolence.
